results.title: How the ‘Many Saints of Newark’ Stars Remade Key ‘Sopranos’ Roles
results.abstract: Actors in the prequel had to put their stamp on favorite characters from the original series, whether they had watched it or not.

multimedia.caption: Corey Stoll and Vera Farmiga in “Saints” as younger versions of the indelible “Sopranos” characters Junior Soprano and Livia.

results.title: Ladies and Gentlemen, Daniel Craig
results.abstract: At long last, the star of the James Bond franchise bids farewell to 007 with “No Time to Die” (and learns for the first time about his life as an internet meme).

multimedia.caption: “Maybe I’ll be remembered as the Grumpy Bond,” Daniel Craig said. But, he added, “I’m quite satisfied with that.”
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times

results.title: Alessandro Nivola Put His Foot Down and Won the ‘Many Saints’ Role Anyway
results.abstract: When he landed his first major lead in 25 years, he sobbed. “I’d been down that road so many times, and the number of disappointments I can’t count on 10 hands.”

multimedia.caption: Alessandro Nivola said his wife, Emily Mortimer, and friend Ethan Hawke are relentlessly positive: “I’m trying to be more that way but it’s not my nature.”
multimedia.copyright: Rafael Martinez for The New York Times

results.title: The Academy Museum Finds Good Intentions in Messy Film History

results.abstract: The pair arrived at the International Space Station on Tuesday, aiming to shoot scenes for the first feature film made in orbit.

results.title: Like Captain Kirk, William Shatner Will Travel to Space (Almost)
results.abstract: It’s only the edge of space, but the man who played the “Star Trek” captain is heading there with three other people for Blue Origin’s second flight with passengers.

results.title: Clint Eastwood Wins $6.1 Million CBD Lawsuit
results.abstract: The Academy Award-winning director accused a Lithuanian company of falsely claiming that he had endorsed CBD products.

results.title: Karen Dalton, a Musical Mystery That Doesn’t Need to Be Solved
results.abstract: A new documentary about the blues-folk singer, who died in 1993, works to make her known without unraveling all of her riddles.
des_facet: Karen Dalton: In My Own Time (Movie)

multimedia.caption: Karen Dalton recorded just two albums, suffered drug and alcohol addictions and succumbed to an AIDS-related illness at age 55. But her story is more than simply a tragedy.

results.title: Mesdames et messieurs, Daniel Craig
results.abstract: Avec “Mourir peut attendre”, l’acteur tire sa révérence et dit adieu à 007. Après 15 ans passés à incarner un “Bond Bougon”, il prépare le rôle de Macbeth à Broadway.

multimedia.caption: “Peut-être qu’on se souviendra de moi comme du Bond Bougon,” dit Daniel Craig. Mais il précise: “ça me convient tout à fait.”

results.title: Ruth Sullivan, Advocate for People With Autism, Dies at 97
results.abstract: After her son was found to be autistic, she started organizations to help children and adults. She also consulted on the making of the movie “Rain Man.”

multimedia.caption: Ruth Sullivan, center, with her husband and seven children in an undated photo. Her son Joe, seated to her left, was diagnosed with autism in the early 1960s.
